intro: Cayaponia alata, commonly known as the winged cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems and leaves. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Cayaponia alata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
